channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 12th January
item.description:
There are a couple of obstructions on a bridleway/restricted byway that have been there for sometime. This one is blocked by a fallen tree. Id be grateful if you are able to confirm if this is the correct place to report these issues Many thanks and best wishes
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 12th January
item.description:
There are a couple of obstructions on a bridleway/restricted byway that have been there for sometime. This one is blocked by a fallen telegraph pole and also a number of trees.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No-parking cones been put on the road with no notice of authorisation., 12th January
item.description:
A length of North Road East has had a number of no-parking cones put out along both sides of the road. There are no notices of any authorisation of parking restrictions. There is a road race on Sunday, they have apparently ’applied for’ permission, but in previous years have ‘closed’ the road with no authorisation. Even if it is for Sunday, blocking the road from Friday afternoon does not seem acceptable. The cones were so close together that I couldn’t even safely pull in to let someone past before I reversed into my drive today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Road East, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Falling tree branches damaged car, 12th January
item.description:
Relates to enquiry 11446126. On 29 December large branches fell from the large lime tree on the pavement outside 17 Keynsham Road onto my property, damaging the roof of the car in the photos. A telephone report was made at the time with a request for the tree to be checked, as further branches could fall (see previous report from 21 December). The car has since been declared an insurance writeoff. Please provide an update on the enquiry referenced above. This is not the first time branches of this size have fallen, and in summer dead branches can clearly be seen on the tree as they are not in leaf.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Keynsham Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A gate was padlocked on a public footpath which meant 4 pensioners having to climb over it. Dangerous but no option!, 12th January
item.description:
Per the photograph there is a very clear right of way per the OS app but the gate was padlocked with fences either side so there was no option but to clamber over the gate. We walked it on 26th December 2023.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withington, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Light Filter issue, 12th January
item.description:
The filter when turning right from Cheltenham Road to Old Cheltenham Road (coming from Elmbridge Court) is not working properly. It stays on red, even if there is no traffic coming from the opposite direction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working
